alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:28PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Marion County through 200 PM EDT... At 128 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Santos, or 8 miles southeast of Ocala, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salt Springs, Juniper Springs, Lynne, Santos, Moss Bluff, Silver Springs Shores, Lake Weir, Belleview, Burbank and Summerfield. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
